item.title: Context
item.author: reid@reactific.com (Reid Spencer)
item.description: Introduction To Bounded Contexts DDD defines the notion of a bounded context which is a portion of a domain that has a well-defined and finite boundary, hence the name, bounded context. DDD uses bounded contexts to divide complexity in large knowledge domains into manageable portions. When the knowledge domain is large enough to be past a single human’s comprehension in its entirety, bounded context become a primary model structuring principle.
